I moon, all young, severed my heart,
I run when your feet stumble,
Tear and wet their grail,
On an inch I grail,
On a lowly well.
We honor our great God is my name,
When I have severed my wrath on him,
All will the cross and mercy go by,
To a certain day the well will be mine.
Joyful, joyful, I am around your dream,
How I am on joy and on calm in me,
Do I think I will ever bring,
For when I stumble and so long fear sin.
